Lincoln Center has announced that it is preparing to reopen to the public in early September. The reopening date will be pushed back because of the Covid-19 health crisis.The October 2020 reopening date will be pushed back to mid-September, which would have been the opening of the venue, which houses the Lincoln Center, the Metropolitan Opera, and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, is expected to open on September 29. The next show will be a biennial of American art, which is scheduled to run October 5–12, 2020. The reopening coincides with the ten-day period of high temperatures across the United States, which has been dubbed the "cooling off period." According to the Washington Post, temperatures across the United States are currently at their highest point since the start of the pandemic. The reopening date is also pushed back by a week because of the Labor Day holiday. According to the New York Times, the reopening date is now October 3. The reinstallation of the Lincoln Center in 2008, the Metropolitan Museum of Art in 2007, and the opening of the Museum of Modern Art in 2007 all coincided with the beginning of the pandemic.
